Harpers.synopsis: Dialog with harpers in Danthelon's Dancing Axe basement ambush. A number of doppelgangers have slaughered a Harper troop and stolen their faces, forcing the one surviving Harper to set Jaheira up for an ambush.We can see the trap coming, or pick up on Jaheira's hint that all is not right. Either way, it ends in combat.
Harpers.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main.Teleport to larian://bookmark?name=BGO_DanthelonDancingAxe_Basement&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-20.376675;45.939648;125.109711&camTarget=-19.833111;45.491306;125.819305Talk to any of npcs

AD_GuardWelcome.synopsis: A guard orc standing at Danthelon's Dancing Axe entrance welcomes visitors of the shop
AD_GuardWelcome.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main_A, walk into Danthelon's Dancing Axe atlarian://bookmark?name=BGO_DanthelonDancingAxe&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=0.709298;50.450680;129.280289&camTarget=-0.058590;50.180027;129.860886

PAD_NearShop.synopsis: Played when the party approaches the Danthalon's Dancing Axe shop, if Jaheira has been recruited and mentioned that this is a secret Harpers’ meeting spot. If she's in the party she will remind about this place herself, otherwise the party refers to what she told the player before.

WB_DoppelgangerLeaning.synopsis: Behavior cinematics: doppelganger assassin in a shape of a woman harper stands leaning against a wall.
WB_DoppelgangerLeaning.how_to_trigger: Go to larian://bookmark?mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-11.324713;45.816296;135.551483&camTarget=-11.572932;45.352177;136.401764BUT do not get into sight of npcs, otherwise they'd start a dialog.Can try applying INVISIBILITY status on your player.

Guard_01.synopsis: Danthelon's Dancing Axe guard's dialog. Reacts to the general state in which we visit the shop, but also a line covering the case where we had a secret meeting below and it ended in bloodshed.
Guard_01.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main. From debug book Quest flags and options -> Act3 -> Danthelon Dancing Axe -> Add Jaheira as companion.Dialog with Jaheira starts, accept her as companion.Teleport to larian://bookmark?name=BGO_DanthelonDancingAxe&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=0.709298;50.450680;129.280289&camTarget=-0.058590;50.180027;129.860886Enter the shop, talk to guard.

Guard_02.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main. From debug book Quest flags and options -> Act3 -> Danthelon Dancing Axe -> Add Jaheira as companion.Dialog with Jaheira starts, accept her as companion.Teleport to larian://bookmark?name=BGO_DanthelonDancingAxe&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=0.709298;50.450680;129.280289&camTarget=-0.058590;50.180027;129.860886Enter the shop, talk to guard.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM.synopsis: OOM version of Jaheira's scene with Danthelon as seen in WYR_Axe_Danthelon.

Danthelon.synopsis: A dialog with Danthelon's Dancing Axe shopkeeper Danthelon. He facilitates Jaheira's Harpers having a meeting in his basement, and is an old and long-suffering friend of hers.
Danthelon.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main, from debug book Go to Region -> Act3 -> Wyrm's Crossing -> Axe Trader. Enter the shop, talk to Danthelon.

RealHarper_Dead.synopsis: SwD with dead real harper. N+1 to give information about Minsc.
RealHarper_Dead.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main. From debug book Quest flags and options -> Act3 -> Danthelon Dancing Axe -> Add Jaheira as companion.Dialog with Jaheira starts, accept her as companion.Teleport to larian://bookmark?name=BGO_DanthelonDancingAxe_Basement&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-20.376675;45.939648;125.109711&camTarget=-19.833111;45.491306;125.819305Come closer to harper npcs, combat starts. Kill real harper and then every enemy. Use SwD on harper's corpse.

RealHarper_Alive.synopsis: Dialog with the real harper in Danthelon basement after saving him from a doppelganger ambush. He tells us how Jaheira's Harpers were infiltrated and killed, while he was forced to lure her into a trap. Jaheira will want to dismiss Geraldus for his own safety, but the player can intervene.

PAD_AssassinsDefeated.synopsis: PAD after killing the doppelganger assassins in Danthelon's. Three versions can trigger:1. Player has never seen doppelgangers before2. Player has already seen doppelgangers in Wyrm's Crossing and connects them to the cult.3. Player knows that Orin is a doppelganger and connects them definitively to her / Bhaal.
PAD_AssassinsDefeated.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main.Teleport to larian://bookmark?name=BGO_DanthelonDancingAxe_Basement&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-20.376675;45.939648;125.109711&camTarget=-19.833111;45.491306;125.819305Come close to npcs, combat starts. Kill all enemies.

AD_DoppelgangersUnderAttack.synopsis: Under attack AD for doppelganger assassins waiting for Jaheira+player in Danthelon's Dancing Axe basement.AD is used when doppelgangers are involved in combat before they start their ambush.
AD_DoppelgangersUnderAttack.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main, go to Danthelon's Dancing Axe basement atlarian://bookmark?mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-25.117765;45.375759;142.120224&camTarget=-24.245834;44.894722;142.028564Attack one of the doppelganger harpers (anyone except Geraldus)

AD_HoldTheDoor.synopsis: After player/Jaheira talk to Danthelon and get the key to go to basement, Danthelon orders a guard to hold the door and not let anyone for a while.
AD_HoldTheDoor.how_to_trigger: Part of behaviors, not implemented yet

PAD_AfterGeraldus.synopsis: PAD following Danthelon's Axe to prod players back to Jaheira - Specifically plays if she was not in the party, or potentially too far away to join in.
PAD_AfterGeraldus.how_to_trigger: - Complete Danthelon's without Jaheira, but without her dead- Should play automatically after the resolution with Geraldus

AD_JaheiraAfterAmbush.synopsis: After fighting doppelgangers who pretended to be harpers, Jaheira expresses her regrets about the fate of her friends.

AD_Ambush_RealHarper.synopsis: At combat vs doppelgangers start, harper Geraldus has this AD.
AD_Ambush_RealHarper.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main. From debug book Quest flags and options -> Act3 -> Danthelon Dancing Axe -> Add Jaheira as companion.Dialog with Jaheira starts, accept her as companion.Teleport to larian://bookmark?name=BGO_DanthelonDancingAxe_Basement&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-20.376675;45.939648;125.109711&camTarget=-19.833111;45.491306;125.819305Come closer to harper npcs, combat starts. Real harper has this AD.

Harpers_8.speaker: Harper Geraldus
Harpers_8.text: High Harper. May Selûne's Tears shine on this meeting.
Harpers_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Jaheira in party, player knows harpers are doppelgangers (revelaed through True Sight or elsehow).

Harpers_66.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_66.text: ...A very formal greeting, Geraldus. You are well?
Harpers_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the slightest hesitation - she's caught the use of the code, and is playing along.

Harpers_99.speaker: Harper Geraldus
Harpers_99.text: Y-yes, High Harper. Standing beneath Selûne's Tears.
Harpers_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Over-doing the code now, doesn't realize Jaheira gets it.

Harpers_29.speaker: Hemm
Harpers_29.text: The lad's a little nervous, Jaheira. We heard of your great victory against Ketheric.
Harpers_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper Chelvin steps up beside Geraldus, taking control of the conversation.

Harpers_65.speaker: Narrator
Harpers_65.text: *Geraldus' nerves are nothing to do with Jaheira, and everything to do with the doppelgangers beside him. He's using 'Selûne's Tears' as some kind of code.*

Harpers_25.speaker: Narrator
Harpers_25.text: *Geraldus isn't nervous, he's terrified - and he's using 'Selûne's Tears' as some kind of code.*
Harpers_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Geraldus darting terrified glances at Chelvin and the other Harpers

Harpers_38.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_38.text: I understand, Geraldus. Take a moment.

Harpers_93.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_93.text: And you, Harper - there is something familiar about you.

Harpers_96.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_96.text: Something singular. Absolute, wouldn't you say?
Harpers_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning to player - heavy with meaning, signalling that this Harper is an imposter...

Harpers_73.speaker: Narrator
Harpers_73.text: *'Absolute'. Jaheira seems to believe that all is not right with these Harpers - that they're somehow connected to the cult.*

Harpers_26.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_26.text: Doesn't she remind you of our old friend Marcus?
Harpers_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning to player - heavy with meaning, signalling that this Harper is an imposter.

Harpers_19.speaker: Narrator
Harpers_19.text: *Jaheira's meaning is clear: Marcus was a traitor, laying a trap. The same, it seems, is happening here.*

Harpers_59.speaker: Player
Harpers_59.text: You're a little lost. Probe Geraldus' thoughts.

Harpers_22.speaker: Harper Geraldus
Harpers_22.text: Jaheira will see through them. She must. She's fought doppelgangers before.

Harpers_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Doppelgangers jump forward at player.

Harpers_55.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_55.text: Clever cub. This is an ambush - strike first, while they focus on me.

Harpers_83.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to the player, who just distracted her by trying to read her mind

Harpers_54.speaker: Player
Harpers_54.text: Geraldus is the only Harper here. The others are doppelgangers.

Harpers_74.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_74.text: ..The less subtle approach it is, then.

Harpers_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira draws her weapons (if Bronze anims ONLY)

Harpers_61.speaker: Player
Harpers_61.text: Marcus was a cultist - what are you implying?

Harpers_0.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_0.context: NodeContext: Quiet, long-suffering grunt of exasperation. The player has just missed every single effort she made to single that we're about to be ambushed - so now we're forced to fight.

Harpers_85.speaker: Hemm
Harpers_85.text: Oh, Jaheira. Orin promised you'd make for challenging prey - but then you brought an idiot along.
Harpers_85.context: NodeContext: Sarcastically disappointed, almost pitying - Jaheira just gave us a clear signal that we missed, and the Chelvin/ doppelganger finds it hilarious.

Harpers_88.speaker: Player
Harpers_88.text: Yes, Marcus. Shame such a dashing fellow turned out so evil, isn't it?

Harpers_109.speaker: Player
Harpers_109.text: What? Flirt with your Harpers another time. We're here on business.

Harpers_71.speaker: Player
Harpers_71.text: What is the meaning of 'Selûne's Tears', Jaheira?

Harpers_111.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_111.text: To most people, a rather old-fashioned greeting.

Harpers_11.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_11.text: To a Harper - a signal that there are shapechangers in our midst.

Harpers_60.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_60.text: You should have studied Chelvin before you stole her face. She wasn't much of a smiler.

Harpers_12.speaker: Hemm
Harpers_12.text: Maybe not in your company, Harper. But after I gave her to Orin's blades, I promise you - she was smiling from ear to ear.

Harpers_77.speaker: Player
Harpers_77.text: Quite right - I wonder if the Weave will melt through this lot just as easily.

Harpers_37.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_37.context: NodeContext: decisive, undercutting an ambush suddenly

Harpers_92.speaker: Player
Harpers_92.text: Remain silent and wait for Jaheira's signal.

Harpers_84.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_84.text: The problem with Marcus, of course -
Harpers_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira takes a single step to the side, forcing the imposter Harper to turn with her - leaving the player an opening to strike.

Harpers_1.speaker: Player
Harpers_1.text: Remain silent and wait for Jaheira's signal.

Harpers_58.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_58.text: My friend and I have experience with your kind, you see. The problem -
Harpers_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira takes a single step to the side, forcing the imposter Harper to turn with her - leaving the player an opening to strike.NodeContext: feeding next line 'we didn't end on the best of terms'. She's sussed that the person we're speaking to is a doppelganger and is about to strike first.

Harpers_110.speaker: Jaheira
Harpers_110.text: - we didn't end on the best of terms.

Harpers_42.speaker: Player
Harpers_42.text: Strike while Jaheira has them distracted.

Harpers_36.speaker: Player
Harpers_36.text: Strike while Jaheira has them distracted.

Harpers_98.speaker: Player
Harpers_98.text: Strike while Jaheira has them distracted.

Harpers_50.speaker: Harper Geraldus
Harpers_50.context: InternalNodeContext: Jaheira in not present, player doesn't know harpers are doppelgangers.

Harpers_108.speaker: Harper Geraldus
Harpers_108.text: I... I was hoping to greet the High Harper beneath Selûne's Tears.

Harpers_20.speaker: Hemm
Harpers_20.text: You have the lad a little nervous - you're the one toppled Ketheric out in the shadowlands, no?
Harpers_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper Chelvin steps up beside Geraldus, taking control of the conversation.

Harpers_56.speaker: Narrator
Harpers_56.text: *Geraldus isn't nervous, he's terrified - and he's using 'Selûne's Tears' as some kind of code.*
Harpers_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Geraldus darting terrified glances at Chelvin and the other Harpers

Harpers_69.speaker: Player
Harpers_69.text: You're a little lost. Probe Geraldus' thoughts.

Harpers_7.speaker: Harper Geraldus
Harpers_7.text: Strike, strike, strike - before the doppelgangers do!

Harpers_115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Doppelgangers jump forward at player.

Harpers_103.speaker: Hemm
Harpers_103.text: Stare at me. Study me. This Harper's face bores me - perhaps I'll steal yours next.

Harpers_17.speaker: Player
Harpers_17.text: I'm sorry, Geraldus - you'll have to just say what you mean.

Harpers_67.speaker: Hemm
Harpers_67.text: Geraldus. You spoiled Orin's surprise. We'll deliver you alive for that.

Harpers_117.speaker: Player
Harpers_117.text: Why is he so afraid of you?

Harpers_16.speaker: Player
Harpers_16.text: Ketheric was only the beginning. You have information on the other Chosen?

Harpers_113.speaker: Hemm
Harpers_113.text: Can't say I know much of Gortash. But Orin is hunting you.

Harpers_89.speaker: Hemm
Harpers_89.text: And when I deliver your corpse, she'll let me keep your skin.

Harpers_68.speaker: Hemm
Harpers_68.text: ...Do you know? I took her face - but she died before I could get her name.

Harpers_95.speaker: Hemm
Harpers_95.text: I wonder what Orin plans to do with your face.

Harpers_70.speaker: Player
Harpers_70.text: I come in her stead. You can report to me.

Harpers_78.speaker: Harper Geraldus
Harpers_78.text: High Harper. May Selûne's Tears shine on this meeting.
Harpers_78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hesitant, nervous - stressing the words 'Selune'sTears' as a code and hoping we understand.InternalNodeContext: Jaheira in party, player doesn't know harpers are doppelgangers.

AD_GuardWelcome_0.speaker: Somi
AD_GuardWelcome_0.text: Welcome to Danthelon's Dancing Axe. Our stock isn't 'used' - it's tried and tested by the finest adventurers.
AD_GuardWelcome_0.context: NodeContext: Repeating the same old slogan you're forced to greet every customer with - not particularly enthused.

PAD_NearShop_0.speaker: Player
PAD_NearShop_0.text: Up there. Danthelon's Dancing Axe - the Harper safe-house Jaheira mentioned.

Guard_01_0.speaker: Tairn
Guard_01_0.text: You break it, you - well, knowing Entharl, it was already broken.
Guard_01_0.context: NodeContext: A shop guard who starts the classic 'you break it you bought it' then cuts off to shrug and insult the boss instead.

Guard_01_1.speaker: Tairn
Guard_01_1.text: Sounds like you've left some bodies to bury. Plus side, Entharl pays overtime.

Guard_01_2.speaker: Tairn
Guard_01_2.text: I know he looks sketchy, but Entharl doesn't sell any shite. Throw him a few coins if you can - mainly so he can pay me.

Guard_02_0.speaker: Somi
Guard_02_0.text: Entharl's retired the dancing axe, too. Was the only reason anyone came into this place.

Guard_02_1.speaker: Somi
Guard_02_1.text: Don't draw any trouble on old Entharl. He acts like he's up for it, but he's retired for a reason.

Guard_02_2.speaker: Somi
Guard_02_2.text: Go on. If the Steel Watch come poking around, my brother and I will earn our coin.
Guard_02_2.context: NodeContext: Unfazed - they'll take care of Danthelon, whatever happens

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_12.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_12.text: If your lot have cracked another bloody cask, I -
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_12.context:
InternalNodeContext: Meet Danthelon after fighting harpers doppelgangers
Jaheira is in Jaheira speakerNodeContext: Irritated by the Harper kerfuffle below, but cutting off when he realises something is actually wrong.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_4.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_4.text: They're dead, Entharl. Doppelgangers were using them as bait.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_17.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_17.text: Seems they snared more than they could skin in you. Did Geraldus survive?
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_17.context: NodeContext: A breath, taking the bad news and refocusing himself on the task.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_6.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_6.text: Alive. But he'll need some time to recover.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_19.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_19.text: I'll tuck the boy up tight 'til he's ready to get back to Harpering. What will you do?
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_19.context: NodeContext: Nod, all bluster gone. He'll help the Harpers, because he always does.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_16.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_16.context: NodeContext: Sighing, knows he won't get more from her so not going to stand in her way.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_2.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_2.text: Alive. But a Harper no more. He's better off out of it.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_20.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_20.text: Likely you're right. I'll tuck him up tight 'til I can ship him back to his mother. What are you going to do?
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_20.context: NodeContext: Nod, all bluster gone. He'll help the Harpers, because he always does.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_21.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_21.text: Waste. A bloody waste. What will you do now?
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_21.context: NodeContext: Quiet frustration and sadness - he talks a lot of shit about Harpers, but Geraldus was just a kid.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_13.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_13.text: Greetings, saer. Your noble bearing brings a little class to my humble -
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_13.context:
InternalNodeContext: Meet Danthelon before going to harpers basement
Jaheira is in Jaheira speaker slotNodeContext: Repeating sales pitch by rote without initially looking at who's at his counter - cuts off when he sees

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_5.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_5.text: Blueberries. Thought I had a sale. You look tired, Harper.
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_5.context: NodeContext: 'Blueberries' - seemingly a polite curse, but with all the vehemence of 'balls / bollocks'

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_15.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_15.text: I missed you too. They're already here?

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_8.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_8.context: NodeContext: Sighing, now certain he's not making a sale but getting on with business.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_18.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_18.text: That depends - you plan on buying anything?

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_1.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_1.context: NodeContext: Wistful - Harpers never buy anything from him.

Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_14.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_14.text: Down below. Can't find the key, but a locked door's never stopped you.
Danthelon_Jaheira_OOM_14.context: NodeContext: Sighing, now certain he's not making a sale but getting on with business.

AD_Gale_Karlach_3.speaker: Karlach
AD_Gale_Karlach_3.text: Wouldn't mind a dancing axe of my own.

AD_Gale_Karlach_1.speaker: Gale
AD_Gale_Karlach_1.text: A simple movement charm wouldn't be too hard to apply to such an object. I could conjure one up for you if you like?

AD_Gale_Karlach_2.speaker: Gale
AD_Gale_Karlach_2.text: Very well then. Once the city is saved, Karlach's Kinetic Cleaver will be first on my list.

Danthelon_10.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_10.text: I wouldn't keep your contact waiting. Looked a mite twitchy.
Danthelon_10.context:
InternalNodeContext: Talk again to Danthelon before seeing harpers.
GROUP_Players can be Jaheira or not. Dedicated Jaheira slot is empty

Danthelon_123.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_123.text: Unless you're buying - then he can wait 'til the Soul Forge goes dark.

Danthelon_58.speaker: Player
Danthelon_58.text: Entharl - the Harpers are dead. Doppelgangers took their place.

Danthelon_34.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_34.text: Doppelgangers...? If this is some kind of Harper test, friend, you'll find I'm testy enough by myself.

Danthelon_73.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_73.text: Greetings, saer. Your noble bearing brings a little class to my humble establishment.
Danthelon_73.context:
InternalNodeContext: Meet Danthelon before going to harpers basement
No JaheiraNodeContext: Air of salesman, but a little tired - like he's making this pitch by rote

Danthelon_128.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_128.text: How may I be of service?
Danthelon_128.context: NodeContext: Air of salesman, but a little tired - like he's making this pitch by rote

Danthelon_22.speaker: Player
Danthelon_22.text: Jaheira sent me. I'm to meet some Harpers here.

Danthelon_117.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_117.text: Harpers? I'm afraid I serve a grubbier class of clientele than that.
Danthelon_117.context: NodeContext: Feigned ignorance, not overdone. Just bemused: 'no sir, I definitely don't work for that super spy network'

Danthelon_92.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_92.text: More chancers than champions, if you take my meaning. Present company excluded, I'm sure.
Danthelon_92.context: NodeContext: Cheery tone - his clientele aren't nearly so NOBLE or HEROIC as the Harpers

Danthelon_116.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_116.text: No, I don't know any... Jaheira, was it?
Danthelon_116.context: NodeContext: Trailing off, still feigning ignorance, trying to get us off the topic

Danthelon_30.speaker: Player
Danthelon_30.text: It was. And she certainly knows who you are.

Danthelon_48.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_48.text: I knew it. I knew she wasn't dead.
Danthelon_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Exaggerated looking aroud before leaning in to speak in quieter tones, the salesman act goneNodeContext: looking aroud before leaning in to speak in quieter tones, the salesman act gone

Danthelon_44.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_44.text: Fine, yes - you have the right place. But where's the leaf-licker herself?
Danthelon_44.context: NodeContext: Fully dropping the act - now looking to us to update on what went wrong / why Jaheira isn't here

Danthelon_15.speaker: Player
Danthelon_15.text: Elsewhere, but she trusts me with this.

Danthelon_9.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_9.text: She wouldn't have revealed this place otherwise. Which makes you one of the rare breed she does trust.
Danthelon_9.context: NodeContext: Eyeing us up and down. Should be dubious as to whether being trusted by Jaheira is a thing to be proud of or not, despite him belonging in the same camp.

Danthelon_107.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_107.text: Here's the key. The others are below - and bearing bad news, by the looks of it.

Danthelon_66.speaker: Player
Danthelon_66.text: Before that - is there time to trade?

Danthelon_112.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_112.context: NodeContext: emphasis on second word - he's being sarcastic, but not aggressively so

Danthelon_115.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_115.text: Make your way below. The others are waiting - with bad news, by the looks of it.

Danthelon_37.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_37.text: Needless paranoia. Had you opened with that, I'd have known you for a Harper straight off.
Danthelon_37.context: NodeContext: Crisp, classifying us immediately - not at all bothered by our self-important secrecy

Danthelon_64.speaker: Player
Danthelon_64.text: Stop lying. Jaheira's been known to feed people truth-herbs.

Danthelon_125.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_125.text: ...Klauthgrass. I know the taste all too well. You too, I'd wager.
Danthelon_125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Exaggerated looking aroud before leaning in to speak in quieter tones, the salesman act goneNodeContext:  looking aroud before leaning in to speak in quieter tones, the salesman act gone

Danthelon_2.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_2.text: Anything else I can aid you with?

Danthelon_137.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_137.text: I'm glad you're safe, Entharl. My Harpers - they were replaced by doppelgangers.
Danthelon_137.context: InternalNodeContext: Feels like she'd be happy he's unharmed, but since we lack any more lines we can get from him, maybe this is overkill. Specifically here if Jaheira knows about her Harpelgangers but the player hasn't talked about it yet/NodeContext: Breaking grim news as gently as she can, but angry about it herself

Danthelon_51.speaker: Player
Danthelon_51.text: Did you know the Harpers here were actually doppelgangers?
Danthelon_51.context: InternalNodeContext: After the fact - You've bypassed Danthelon's entirely, meaning the Doppels got away, then come back.

Danthelon_126.speaker: Player
Danthelon_126.text: Let's see what you have to trade.

Danthelon_78.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_78.text: What, by the Mordinsamman's curlies, went on down there?
Danthelon_78.context: InternalNodeContext: After combat with doppelgangers happened in shop's basement.NodeContext: Hissed through gritted teeth - he heard sounds of violence below.

Danthelon_104.speaker: Player
Danthelon_104.text: Our Harpers turned out to be shapeshifter assassins.

Danthelon_42.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_42.context: NodeContext: Quietly furious, not appreciating our joke

Danthelon_38.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_38.text: So you'd be one of Jaheira's then, would you?
Danthelon_38.context: NodeContext: Grudgingly locking down his anger to get on with things - eyeing us up and down. If we're with Jaheira, then he's going to help us.

Danthelon_124.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_124.text: Clear out, then. I'm guessing I have some tidying to do before the Steel Watch squeals by.
Danthelon_124.context: NodeContext: Sigh, locking down anger as he resigns himself to help clear up another Harper mess

Danthelon_102.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_102.text: Clear out, then. I have some tidying to do in case the Watchers get up and running again.
Danthelon_102.context: NodeContext: Sigh, locking down anger as he resigns himself to help clear up another Harper mess

Danthelon_133.speaker: Player
Danthelon_133.text: That's it, no more questions asked?

Danthelon_28.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_28.text: Plenty, but I'll bend Jaheira's pointy old ears when all of this is done. She'll owe me a whole cask of drinks by then.

Danthelon_71.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_71.text: I've had enough dealings with Harpers to know I don't want the answers. Go on, now.

Danthelon_3.speaker: Player
Danthelon_3.text: I'd like to see your wares first.

Danthelon_101.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_101.text: I don't care much for your timing, but I like your gold well enough.

Danthelon_79.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_79.text: If your lot have cracked another bloody cask, I -
Danthelon_79.context:
InternalNodeContext: Meet Danthelon after fighting harpers doppelgangers
Jaheira is in Jaheira speakerNodeContext: Irritated by the Harper kerfuffle below, but cutting off when he realises something is actually wrong.

Danthelon_67.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_67.text: They're dead, Entharl. Doppelgangers were using them as bait.

Danthelon_105.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_105.text: Seems they snared more than they could skin in you. Did Geraldus survive?
Danthelon_105.context: NodeContext: A breath, taking the bad news and refocusing himself on the task.

Danthelon_56.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_56.text: Alive. But he'll need some time to recover.

Danthelon_135.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_135.text: I'll tuck the boy up tight 'til he's ready to get back to Harpering. What will you do?
Danthelon_135.context: NodeContext: Nod, all bluster gone. He'll help the Harpers, because he always does.

Danthelon_0.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_0.text: Alive. But a Harper no more. He's better off out of it.

Danthelon_4.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_4.text: Likely you're right. I'll tuck him up tight 'til I can ship him back to his mother. What are you going to do?
Danthelon_4.context: NodeContext: Nod, all bluster gone. He'll help the Harpers, because he always does.

Danthelon_118.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_118.context: NodeContext: Sighing, knows he won't get more from her so not going to stand in her way.

Danthelon_61.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_61.text: Waste. A bloody waste. What will you do now?
Danthelon_61.context: NodeContext: Quiet frustration and sadness - he talks a lot of shit about Harpers, but Geraldus was just a kid.

Danthelon_84.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_84.text: Greetings, saer. Your noble bearing brings a little class to my humble -
Danthelon_84.context:
InternalNodeContext: Meet Danthelon before going to harpers basement
Jaheira is in Jaheira speaker slotNodeContext: Repeating sales pitch by rote without initially looking at who's at his counter - cuts off when he sees

Danthelon_108.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_108.text: You can turn off the charm, Entharl. They're with me.

Danthelon_96.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_96.text: Blueberries. Thought I had a sale. You look tired, Harper.
Danthelon_96.context: NodeContext: 'Blueberries' - seemingly a polite curse, but with all the vehemence of 'balls / bollocks'

Danthelon_97.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_97.text: I missed you too. They're already here?

Danthelon_18.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_18.context: NodeContext: Sighing, now certain he's not making a sale but getting on with business.

Danthelon_100.speaker: Player
Danthelon_100.text: We were looking for a safe-house. This doesn't look like one.

Danthelon_103.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_103.text: Agreed. Didn't stop Jaheira's lot from nesting in my cellar.

Danthelon_55.speaker: Player
Danthelon_55.text: Pleased to meet you, Harper Entharl.

Danthelon_95.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_95.text: You seem a nice sort, so I'll assume the insult was accidental.
Danthelon_95.context: NodeContext: Polite tone of threat, no actual venom in it.

Danthelon_89.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_89.text: Entharl's no Harper, and claims no love for those who are. But he's been known to shelter us when we need it.

Danthelon_50.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_50.text: Entharl has been known to charge rent. Harpers have been known to ignore him.

Danthelon_52.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_52.text: Now go on. The Short Father may send me an actual paying customer today.

Danthelon_20.speaker: Player
Danthelon_20.text: Wait. I would like to take a look at your stock.

Danthelon_136.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_136.text: To buy?  You're already my favourite.

Danthelon_17.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_17.text: A pleasure. Jaheira needs more friends like you.

Danthelon_99.speaker: Player
Danthelon_99.text: Do Harpers ever just stop and say hello?

Danthelon_120.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_120.text: Hah! Clearly, you do not know our Harper most High.
Danthelon_120.context: NodeContext: Snort of derision and sarcastic spin on the title - High Harper Jaheira is an old friend of his.

Danthelon_16.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_16.text: I wouldn't say that. We've travelled a long road together in a short time.

Danthelon_91.speaker: Jaheira
Danthelon_91.text: The others will be taking their ease here. Entharl has been known to shelter Harpers when they need it.

Danthelon_81.speaker: Player
Danthelon_81.text: You're a trader, Entharl? Let's see your stock.

Danthelon_138.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_138.text: Oh aye, Helm forbid someone might pay for my services, Jaheira.
Danthelon_138.context: NodeContext: Defensive at Jaheira, who's trying to interrupt an actual sale

Danthelon_106.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_106.text: Harpers nesting in your cellar tends to scare off business. So if you mean to sling some coin around, only Jaheira will complain.
Danthelon_106.context: NodeContext: Back to us, eager to trade

Danthelon_11.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_11.text: Bah. She might make a Harper of you yet.
Danthelon_11.context: NodeContext: Grunt - we have disappointed him, but he'll get over it

Danthelon_98.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_98.text: Down below. Can't find the key, but a locked door's never stopped you.
Danthelon_98.context: NodeContext: Sighing, now certain he's not making a sale but getting on with business.

Danthelon_88.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_88.context:
InternalNodeContext: After first meeting Danthelon or After doppelganger scene and after Danthelon knows about it
Jaheira is speaker in GROUP_Players speakerNodeContext: Mock formality to Jaheira - they're old friends, and she never actually buys anything

Danthelon_93.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_93.text: And who the hells are you, and what were you doing down there?
Danthelon_93.context: InternalNodeContext: After combat with doppelgangers happened in shop's basement.NodeContext: Hushed fury, but reining it in while he waits for our answer.

Danthelon_46.speaker: Player
Danthelon_46.text: Meeting the Harpers below. Turns out they were doppelgangers.

Danthelon_132.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_132.text: Of course. Of course they bloody did.

Danthelon_90.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_90.text: That depends - you plan on buying anything?

Danthelon_41.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_41.context: NodeContext: Wistful - Harpers never buy anything from him.

Danthelon_121.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_121.context:
InternalNodeContext: After first meeting Danthelon or After doppelganger scene and after Danthelon knows about it
No Jaheira speaker

Danthelon_127.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_127.text: Haven't seen any Harpers come up. They still down there, frothing over battle-plans?
Danthelon_127.context:
InternalNodeContext: Talk again to Danthelon after recognizing harpers as doppelgangers (no fight yet).
GROUP_Players can be Jaheira or not. Dedicated Jaheira slot is empty

Danthelon_39.speaker: Player
Danthelon_39.text: I think they're impostors - preparing an ambush.

Danthelon_35.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_35.text: ...No. Not Geraldus. Boy's too honest. The others? Not sure.

Danthelon_24.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_24.text: But what are you doing up here? Jaheira might not need your help, but she'd surely appreciate it.
Danthelon_24.context: InternalNodeContext: No Jaheira in this branch.

Danthelon_76.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
Danthelon_76.text: But what are you doing up here? The boy is in danger!

Danthelon_69.speaker: Player
Danthelon_69.text: They are. I'd like to trade.

RealHarper_Dead_20.speaker: Narrator
RealHarper_Dead_20.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

RealHarper_Dead_21.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Dead_21.text: What did you learn about the cult?

RealHarper_Dead_13.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Dead_13.text: What can you tell me about the cult?

RealHarper_Dead_19.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Dead_19.text: Why did you set up this meeting?

RealHarper_Dead_0.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Dead_0.text: What information did you have for Jaheira?

RealHarper_Dead_26.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Dead_26.text: What information did you have for Jaheira?

RealHarper_Dead_5.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Dead_5.text: Do you know who the Rashemaar is?

RealHarper_Dead_25.speaker: Narrator
RealHarper_Dead_25.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

RealHarper_Alive_25.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_25.text: And some explaining to do, it seems.
RealHarper_Alive_25.context: NodeContext: Tired sigh, resigned to tell the player everything.

RealHarper_Alive_47.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_47.text: Did I - did I get it right?
RealHarper_Alive_47.context: InternalNodeContext: Player and Jahiera are talking to harper

RealHarper_Alive_41.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_41.text: Selûne's Tears. It is said no false face can stand beneath their light.

RealHarper_Alive_15.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_15.text: An old code, Harper - but yes, you got it right. Now I need your report.

RealHarper_Alive_48.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_48.text: We had eyes on suspected cultists in the city, like you asked. We thought we were tracking them, but...

RealHarper_Alive_30.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_30.text: They were tracking you instead, evidently. Doppelgangers.

RealHarper_Alive_12.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_12.text: And they're not just working with the cult, High Harper - they're part of it. Bhaalists, I think.

RealHarper_Alive_61.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_61.text: Sworn to Orin the Red, yes. We've... already had the pleasure. Go on.

RealHarper_Alive_65.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_65.text: Everything seemed fine, until... your latest orders. Until we started to search for the Rashemaar.

RealHarper_Alive_38.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_38.text: They struck the same night. I woke to one of them strangling Chelvin, while smiling at me out of her face.

RealHarper_Alive_45.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_45.text: She said - it said - that I'd report back to you as normal. Lure you here, and... I had no choice.

RealHarper_Alive_7.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_7.text: I'm sure it felt that way, Geraldus. The others were likely dragged back to Orin. Tortured. Sacrificed.

RealHarper_Alive_31.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_31.text: I do not expect you to die for me. But to risk Entharl? Any citizen who might have wandered in?

RealHarper_Alive_74.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_74.text: There is always a choice - and a Harper must be able to make the hard ones. Perhaps this isn't the life for you after all, Geraldus.

RealHarper_Alive_13.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_13.text: No. Jaheira - High Harper - please. I'm still a Harper. I want to help.

RealHarper_Alive_72.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_72.text: You've scarcely signed up, boy, and there is a war coming. Why die a Harper, when you could still live as anything else?

RealHarper_Alive_60.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_60.text: No one can make that choice for him. Not even you, High Harper.

RealHarper_Alive_82.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_82.text: I want to fight... for Chelvin. For all of them. So it means something.

RealHarper_Alive_80.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_80.text: Death is death. To look for meaning in it is foolishness, boy. Childish, storybook nonsense.

RealHarper_Alive_64.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_64.text: ...Exactly the kind a Harper would spout, I suppose. Fine. I have no right to make the choice for you.

RealHarper_Alive_17.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_17.text: Not when this mess is of my making. I sent the Harpers hunting after the cult without thinking what it would mean to be hunted in turn. Now they are compromised.

RealHarper_Alive_49.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_49.text: She's right, Geraldus. You did your part. Go live your life.

RealHarper_Alive_21.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_21.text: This work isn't for everyone, boy, and there's no shame in that. Go home to your mother, and leave the task to us.

RealHarper_Alive_18.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_18.text: Wait, Jaheira. You're acting like this is his fault - it's yours.

RealHarper_Alive_36.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_36.text: I most humbly beg your pardon?
RealHarper_Alive_36.context: NodeContext: Translation: What the fuck did you just say?

RealHarper_Alive_23.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_23.text: This talk of the Rashemaar. It sounds like you sent Harpers hunting something you shouldn't have.

RealHarper_Alive_55.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_55.text: You speak of something you know nothing about. But then - why would you, when I have not told it?

RealHarper_Alive_1.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_1.text: Geraldus lived so he could warn you. Don't Harpers serve the greater good?

RealHarper_Alive_78.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_78.text: You volunteer wisdom where it is not wanted. All the more galling, then, that you are right.

RealHarper_Alive_9.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_9.text: I will not. If I bare my teeth, it is probably because you have struck at a sore spot.

RealHarper_Alive_50.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_50.text: This mess is of my making. I sent the Harpers hunting after the cult without thinking what it would mean to be hunted in turn. Now they are compromised.

RealHarper_Alive_34.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_34.text: And if not for you, I wouldn't even know it. I'm sorry, Geraldus. Harper.

RealHarper_Alive_57.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_57.text: And I owe you an apology, as well. I haven't told you everything I hoped to learn here today.

RealHarper_Alive_32.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_32.text: First, Geraldus - you're the last Harper in the city I can rely on. Lay low, and rest while you can. I have matters to discuss with my friend here.

RealHarper_Alive_71.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_71.text: Enough of the Harper dramatics. What do we do now?

RealHarper_Alive_44.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_44.text: I'll come clean. I did not tell you all about what I hoped to learn here today - I will rectify that.

RealHarper_Alive_54.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_54.text: But first - Geraldus. Does your mother still own that farm in the Dalelands?

RealHarper_Alive_58.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_58.text: Just Jaheira to you, now. Go on - I have all the help I need.

RealHarper_Alive_81.speaker: Jaheira
RealHarper_Alive_81.text: Answering to Orin the Red, then. Go on.
RealHarper_Alive_81.context: NodeContext: Quick, grim pause for thought on the idea of Orin having a horde of shapeshifters in her service. Brusquely back to the point, keeping Geraldus on topic.

RealHarper_Alive_70.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_70.context: InternalNodeContext: Only player (not Jaheira) is talking to harper

RealHarper_Alive_67.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_67.text: No thanks necessary. Are you hurt?

RealHarper_Alive_66.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_66.text: I'm... alive. That's more than the others can say.

RealHarper_Alive_3.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_3.text: Don't thank me yet. How do I know you're not a doppelganger, too?

RealHarper_Alive_77.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_77.text: What was all that 'Selûne's Tears' nonsense?

RealHarper_Alive_28.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_28.text: A Harper code. Meant to be used for doppelgangers, impostors. Things like them.

RealHarper_Alive_73.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_73.text: You're... you're the one High Harper Jaheira sent?

RealHarper_Alive_52.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_52.text: I am. I'm here to help.

RealHarper_Alive_14.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_14.text: Oh thank the gods. You're the first friendly face I've seen in days, old Danthelon included.

RealHarper_Alive_76.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_76.text: She didn't send me anywhere. We're allies. Equals.

RealHarper_Alive_11.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_11.text: Right... equal to the High Harper. You can give her my report, then.

RealHarper_Alive_46.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_46.text: I'm not a Harper. I was just passing by.

RealHarper_Alive_6.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_6.text: Old Danthelon wouldn't have let you down here without Jaheira's say-so. I'll give you my report - it's up to you after that.

RealHarper_Alive_35.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_35.text: The others... they're all dead, or scattered. Jaheira sent word of the victory over Ketheric, set us hunting after cultists in the city.

RealHarper_Alive_29.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_29.text: But they were the ones hunting us. Things were quiet - until we started to ask about the Rashemaar.

RealHarper_Alive_59.speaker: Narrator
RealHarper_Alive_59.text: *Rashemaar - a native of Rashemen, the far eastern land known for its wild inhabitants and the witches who rule them.*

RealHarper_Alive_33.speaker: Player
RealHarper_Alive_33.text: Who is this Rashemaar? What does Jaheira want with them?

RealHarper_Alive_51.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_51.text: I... the High Harper didn't tell you? Perhaps... it's not my place.

RealHarper_Alive_24.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_24.text: You saw it. The cult fell on my friends, and took their faces. All because Jaheira sent us searching for him.

RealHarper_Alive_53.speaker: Harper Geraldus
RealHarper_Alive_53.text: Just... tell her this. I can't continue the hunt. Whatever the cult has done with the Rashemaar - they do not want him found.

PAD_AssassinsDefeated_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AssassinsDefeated_0.text: More of Orin's doppelgangers. How many has she brought to Bhaal's side, I wonder?

PAD_AssassinsDefeated_1.speaker: Player
PAD_AssassinsDefeated_1.text: Shapeshifter assassins? Makes it hard to trust anyone.

PAD_AssassinsDefeated_2.speaker: Player
PAD_AssassinsDefeated_2.text: More doppelgangers. The Absolute has won their loyalty, it seems.

AD_DoppelgangersUnderAttack_0.speaker: Gavv, Hemm, Lunn
AD_DoppelgangersUnderAttack_0.text: Aw, our cover's blown. The messy way it is!
AD_DoppelgangersUnderAttack_0.context: NodeContext: A little sadistic - we've blown their cover, but they're happy to go the violent route

AD_HoldTheDoor_1.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
AD_HoldTheDoor_1.text: Right Somi, you're on the door 'til our friends are done. Gods forbid we do any business today.
AD_HoldTheDoor_1.context: NodeContext: SOM-ee. Feigned put-upon, you're closing your shop so your spy friends can have their meeting.

AD_HoldTheDoor_0.speaker: Somi
AD_HoldTheDoor_0.text: Ain't had a customer yet anyway.
AD_HoldTheDoor_0.context: NodeContext: Baldly puncturing your boss' pretense that business is booming

AD_HoldTheDoor_2.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
AD_HoldTheDoor_2.text: Oof. At least pretend to whisper, pal.
AD_HoldTheDoor_2.context: NodeContext: Casual mock-hurt - this is standard chat with your employee, not a big display

PAD_AfterGeraldus_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterGeraldus_0.text: Jaheira's Harpers are doppelgangers. She'll want to know right away.

AD_JaheiraAfterAmbush_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraAfterAmbush_0.text: Malar's mark. How many more Harpers dead?
AD_JaheiraAfterAmbush_0.context: NodeContext: 'Malar's mark' = a druidic 'god fucking damn it'. Frustrated grief - but quiet rather than an outburst

AD_Ambush_RealHarper_0.speaker: Harper Geraldus
AD_Ambush_RealHarper_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Player succeded to understand the secret code and realize its a trap.NodeContext: Harper battle-cry- should be a little weedy, as Geraldus is a tryhard but good-hearted novice

AD_Ambush_RealHarper_1.speaker: Harper Geraldus
